having to accept a living that is not full (2)

so as to resemble the kajal beard of the lizard with a sharp tail, (5)

like elephants from whom must has withdrawn, (8)

[and] viciously harass [us], at a time when there is no enmity [between us]. (13)

like the kings without honour, (21)
who cast off in broad day[light their] nine parasols, (20)

that is not worn , over those who could not stand before [him], (18f.)
who camped in the region he coveted with [his] frightening army (17)
of good horses with a [fast] gait whose broad manes shone, (16)
you will indeed run from us, north-wind. (22)
